inventoryprofiles.gui.config.title: Inventory Profiles Next v%s Configuration Menu
inventoryprofiles.common.gui.config.keyb:
- Left click to configure
- Right click to reset to defaults
inventoryprofiles.config.description.rel: Reload all rule.*.txt files from the config folder
inventoryprofiles.config.description.sor: The sorting method used for inventory sorting
inventoryprofiles.config.description.cus: The rule for custom sorting method
inventoryprofiles.config.description.inc: Hold this key to include hotbar
inventoryprofiles.config.description.mov: Hold this key to move/throw all

Hold this key to move all the items of the type under the cursor or currently held in the cursor.
NOTE: This will move all the items of the selected type despite it already being present on the other side.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.alw: Include hotbar without holding the modifier key (then holding the modifier key is to exclude hotbar)
Move all without holding the modifier key (then holding the modifier key is to move matching items only)
Throw all without holding the modifier key (the holding the modifier key is to throw matching items only)
inventoryprofiles.config.description.hig: If true the highlight will be drown over the whole slot, if false only the background and not the item will be highlighted.
If true the items highlight will blink, if false the highlight will be static.
If true all the items with the same type as the items under cursor will be highlighted.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.ena:
Enables profiles support.
Profiles are sets of gear you can switch between with a single button.

If you wanna learn how to setup the Profile Support go to the "Edit Profiles" page.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.pro: If set to true you will have different set of profiles for every server you connect to.
inventoryprofiles.config.name.enable_loc: Enable Unique Locked Slots per World/Server
inventoryprofiles.config.description.ena:
Locked slots are ignored for: sort, move all, clean cursor, continuous crafting supplies storage, auto refill supplies storage (auto refill monitoring slots are not affected). 
Notice:
Sorting in columns/rows only works if the shape of remaining non-locked slots is rectangular.

If enabled every server and uniquely named world will have their own locked slots.
Notice:
1. If you tend to name all your worlds "New World" they will all share the same locked slots.
2. Servers behind bungee cord/velocity proxies will share locked slots.

Display message if a new version of the mod is available. To do the check we send to our servers ONLY the following information:
	Minecraft Version, Fabric or Forge, Inventory Profiles Next version.
Your IP address is not saved!

Enable Analytics.
Only information about the mod and which features are used is collected.
NO Personal information is sent. Your IP address is not stored.
None of the collected information will be shared, sold or transferred to anyone!
inventoryprofiles.config.name.auto_craft: Wait Ticks Before Next Craft Click
inventoryprofiles.config.description.for: This enables a category with very rudimentary tools for managing GUI Integration Hints.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.add:
Adds some time between clicks while sorting/moving. 
The amount of time is controlled by "Interval Between Clicks (in Milliseconds)". 

This might be useful on some servers that don't like fast clicks.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.int:
Interval between clicks, in milliseconds. 
For some servers 67 or more is recommended.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.aut:
Wait this number of client ticks before doing next craft while auto-crafting.
Increase this if auto-crafting stops before it uses all available resources.
This is server ping dependent. The higher the ping the higher the value is needed.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.con:
Method 2 is pre 1.3.7 behaviour, Method 1 is post 1.3.7.
Method 1 is better overall, but Method 2 works better on some servers.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.res: The hotbar will be restocked during the sort procedure.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.sor:
If this is true, using sort hotkey will sort the slots that under the cursor.
Default behavior is to always sort the opened container.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.mov:
When this is true "Move All" hotkey move from slots under the cursor. 
When false it will always move from player to container.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.sto:
If "Add Interval Between Clicks" is enabled sort operation could take long time. If we are sorting the player inventory it is possible to continue even if the inventory screen is closed. 
This setting controls whether we should stop the sort process if the screen is closed.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.ign: If set to true Move Matching and Throw Matching operations will ignore the item durability when deciding what to move or throw.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.ena: When enabled a small button will appear in the to left of the screen that will open the IPN Overlay Editor.

This enables small 3 button user interface under the player inventory screen that can be used to switch between profiles and apply the currently active one.
All of the Gui functions are available as shortcuts.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.pro: The current profile is announced with a text popup just over the Hotbar.
inventoryprofiles.config.name.treat_unkn: Add Inventory Buttons to All In Game Screens
inventoryprofiles.config.description.ena: This controls whether we add our buttons to the container screen.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.tre:
This is mostly for compatibility with other mods that have introduce screens which are not real inventory.
Setting this to false will disable the inserting of widgets for all but vanilla screens.

NOTE: This is deprecated and will be removed in version 1.2.0.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.sho:
Show continuous crafting checkbox in crafting table and survival inventory.
"Continuous Crafting" will auto refill the recipe ingredients in the crafting grid.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.con: This setting controls if the checkbox state is preserved after the screen is closed or is always reset to the configured value below.
The saved/default value of the "Continuous Crafting" checkbox.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.sho: Show "Sort" button in the container/player Gui.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.reg: Set the post action for "Sort" button.
Set the sort order for "Sort" button.
Set the custom rule for "Sort" button.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.sho: Show the "Sort in Columns" button in the container/player Gui.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.in_: Set the post action for "Sort in Columns" button
Set the sort order for "Sort in Columns" button
Set the custom rule for sort in columns button
inventoryprofiles.config.description.sho: Show "Sort in Rows" button in the container/player Gui.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.in_: Set the post action for "Sort in Rows" button.
Set the sort order for "Sort in Rows" button.
Set the custom rule for "Sort in Rows" button.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.sho: Show "Move All" buttons in the container/player Gui.
inventoryprofiles.config.name.auto_refil: Number of Ticks to Wait Before Auto Refill
inventoryprofiles.config.name.allow_brea: Allow Some Non Enchanted Gear to Break
inventoryprofiles.config.description.typ: Controls what type of visual alert is used when a tool can't be replaced.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.aud: If enabled you will get sound alert when a tool replace was unsuccessful.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.vis: If enabled you will get visual alert when a tool replace was unsuccessful.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.typ: Controls what type of visual alert is used when a tool have been replaced.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.aud: If enabled you will get sound alert when a tool is replaced because of depleted durability.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.vis: If enabled you will get visual alert when a tool is replaced because of depleted durability.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.num: How many notification you will get before the switch
inventoryprofiles.config.description.aud: If enabled a specific sound will be played when a tool durability is close to switch point.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.typ: Controls what type of visual alert is used in case a tool durability is close to switch point.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.vis: This enables visual notifications when a tool/armor durability is getting close to the level for replacement.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.ena: Refill the active item when the stack runs out.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.ign: Allow Auto Refill to use items from locked slots.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.ref: Refill armor slots if items are about to break

Refill tools and armor before they break.
See "Damage Threshold" for more information.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.dis:
Disable replacement of Loyalty enchanted gear.
When this is true anything that is enchanted with any level of Loyalty
 will not be replaced when thrown or dropped.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.aut:
Comma separated list of item types to that will be ignored by Auto refill
For example 'minecraft:golden_axe,minecraft:stone'
WARNING:
To avoid performance degradation DO NOT put too many item types in the list!
inventoryprofiles.config.description.too: Controls the durability level that will trigger auto refill.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.thr:
Set the unit for "Damage Threshold".
Absolute value and percentage (%%) are supported.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.aut:
Auto refill will wait this many ticks before doing the swap. 
This might be useful on some during high server lag. 
However, depending on the "Damage Threshold" value, the tool might break before a swap is initiated.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.all:
Don't try to save non enchanted items.
That has maximum durability less than the setting below.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.too:
Tools with maximum durability below this value will be allowed to break if the setting above is true.
The idea that most players don't really want to keep stone tools,
 but will be annoyed if they break a diamond one.
inventoryprofiles.config.name.also_show_: Also Show Locked Slots in Hotbar
inventoryprofiles.config.name.locked_slo: Disable Shift+Click and Ctrl+Q and Q
Disable (Q) Drop For Non-Stackable Locked Slots In Game
Enable Picking Items into Empty Locked Slots
Maximum Ticks to Wait on Dimension Change
inventoryprofiles.config.name.lock_slots: Disable All User Input on Locked Slots
inventoryprofiles.config.name.locked_slo: Pick Items Directly into the Inventory
inventoryprofiles.config.description.loc: Config lock slots by "Config Key" while holding this key (Default Alt + Left Click to config lock slots)
Config lock slots while holding modifier key (Default Alt + Left Click to config lock slots)
Config lock slots without holding modifier key
Quick disable lock slots when this key is being held down
Set config switch type to toggle or hold
inventoryprofiles.config.description.sho:
Draw locked slots background

You can create your own texture and put it in
resourcepacks/§o[pack_name]§r/assets/inventoryprofilesnext/textures/gui/overlay.png

Draw locked slots foreground

You can create your own texture and put it in
resourcepacks/§o[pack_name]§r/assets/inventoryprofilesnext/textures/gui/overlay.png
inventoryprofiles.config.description.als: When enabled locked slots are also rendered in the HUD Hotbar
inventoryprofiles.config.description.loc:
Select foreground style from preset

You can create your own texture and put it in
resourcepacks/§o[pack_name]§r/assets/inventoryprofilesnext/textures/gui/overlay.png

In the inventory screen locked slots will be immune to:
 - Shift+Click
 - Ctrl+Q
 - Swipe Shift+Click
 - Swipe Ctrl+Q

Disables Drop operations for hotbar locked slots while in game.
Stopping you from throwing your pickaxe in lava.

Should it be possible to pick items from the ground into EMPTY locked slots.
Stackable items will still be picked into locked sots of the same item that have room.
NOTE: See next setting description for more information!

This will try to pickup items directly into the inventory instead of taking empty slot from the hotbar.
NOTE: For this to work "Enable Picking Items into Empty Locked Slots" must be set to "false"!

The maximum number of client ticks to wait for the server to send the content of the player inventory. 
If locked slots get items moved out/thrown away on dimension change you need to increase this value.
This often happens on servers under heavy load.
NOTE: 20 ticks are equivalent of 1 second.
§l§cWARNING§r: Setting this too high MAY lead to locked slot management not working properly until this timeout expires.

The idea is that any user actions on locked slots will be disabled.
Essentially you will need to unlock it before moving, or performing any other action on the item.
Automated actions, profiles, auto refill and so on, are not affected
inventoryprofiles.config.description.qui: The name of the Profile that will be accessible with Quick Profile 1 hot key.
The name of the Profile that will be accessible with Quick Profile 2 hot key.
The name of the Profile that will be accessible with Quick Profile 3 hot key.
inventoryprofiles.config.name.include_cu: Include custom names in the 'Saved' profiles
inventoryprofiles.config.description.inc:
If this is enabled the custom item names will be included in the 'Saved' profiles.
This is NOT recommended for general use, but it's useful is some cases like having a profiles with different backpacks or some other type of storage.

When it comes to normal gear matching by enchantments is the best approach.
inventoryprofiles.config.name.save_as_pr: Save the current state as "Saved" Profile
inventoryprofiles.config.description.sav:
This hotkey saves the current equipment set as a Profile named "Saved".
You can use the Saved profiles to build your own profiles.

§l§cNOTE§r:
EVERY TIME you press it a new Profile named "Saved" is created.
The "Saved" profiles will not be part of the next/previous rotation and cannot be assigned to Quick Profiles.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.nex: Hotkey for changing to the next profile.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.pre: Hotkey for changing to the previous profile.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.pro:
Hotkey for changing to Quick Profile 1.
You can configure the Quick Profiles in the Edit Profiles config page.

Hotkey for changing to Quick Profile 2.
You can configure the Quick Profiles in the Edit Profiles config page.

Hotkey for changing to Quick Profile 3.
You can configure the Quick Profiles in the Edit Profiles config page.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.ope: The key open the in-game configuration.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.sor: The key to sort the inventory.
The key to sort the inventory in columns.
The key to sort the inventory in rows.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.mov: The key to move all the items that already existed in the container
inventoryprofiles.config.description.thr:
The key to throw all items for either player inventory or the opened container.Generally useful for mass crafting.
All modifier keys for Move All Items apply here too.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.dum: Prints the item string with nbt to the chat.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.ope: Show configuration screen for Inventory Profiles Next GUI overlay
inventoryprofiles.config.description.rel:
This hotkey can be used for faster config reloading when you are defining new custom rules.
In ANY other case it's recommended to keep it unset.
Reloading the configurations is not something you want to do often.
inventoryprofiles.config.name.container_: Enable Swipe Moving Items From the Container
inventoryprofiles.config.description.pre: Closing GUI will no longer drop the item that holding by the cursor.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.con: Allows you to move items for the slots under the cursor while holding shift and left click.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.swi: Enable "Swipe Moving Items" in crafting result slot.
inventoryprofiles.config.category.modpac: YOU NEED TO BE IN SINGLE PLAYER GAME OR THESE WILL CRASH YOUR GAME.
inventoryprofiles.config.description.exp:
This generates external hints files that can be distributed as part of the modpack.

NOTE: This will also export everything that is build in the mod.

NOTE: You don't really need this if your modpack has no custom blocks/items.
Our discord server is the place to get help :)
inventoryprofiles.config.description.dif:
This determines in the build in or external hints will have priority when using the export buttons.

NOTE: You don't really need this if your modpack has no custom blocks/items.
Our discord server is the place to get help :)
inventoryprofiles.config.description.exp:
This generates json file with ALL currently loaded hints. The format is only suitable for embedding into the mod it self.

NOTE: You don't really need this if your modpack has no custom blocks/items.
Our discord server is the place to get help :)
inventoryprofiles.config.description.mak:
This button generate a script of /chat commands that will:
 - try to find all blocks that have a GUIs
 - make a nice platform
 - place every block organized by mod

NOTE: You don't really need this if your modpack has no custom blocks/items.
If you want to try this our discord server is the place to get help :)

WARNING: This requires single player world!
inventoryprofiles.tooltip.auto_crafting_:
Auto Crafting
§6Stop holding §o%s§r§6: for Continuous Crafting
inventoryprofiles.tooltip.editor_toggle: Show configuration screen for Inventory Profiles Next GUI overlay
inventoryprofiles.gui.editor.description:
This will cause Inventory Profiles Next to not add it's buttons in the UI and
to disable any management functions for the containers.
NOTE:
Usually it's necessary to set this to true for both Container and Screen.

This will cause Inventory Profiles Next to detect the UI as player inventory only.
NOTE:
Usually you want to set this for both Screen and Container. But do try different combinations.

If set to true swipe move/throw will try to use slower but more reliable method.
NOTE: If you have problems with swipe move/throw for one or more but not all GUIs try setting this to true.

By default if the mod that provides the UI provides compatibility information Inventory Profiles Next will use it
This setting allows you to override the mod.

The Profiles Selector UI should be visible only when the Player inventory screen is shown.
If for some reason it's visible for any other screen setting this to yes will disable it.
'W','S','A','D' and the arrow keys will move the selected button
Holding 'Shift' with Move keys will make the button move faster.
